meanings.definition: Not cumulative; not increasing or accumulating over time.
meanings.sent1: The noncumulative amount of snow on the ground stayed the same all day.
meanings.sent2: Her noncumulative savings in the jar did not grow over the month.
meanings.sent3: The noncumulative pile of laundry seemed to magically stay the same size.
meanings.sent4: The noncumulative effect of the medicine was evident as the pain did not lessen.
meanings.sent5: The noncumulative nature of the task made it easy to complete in one sitting.

meanings.definition: Not added to or carried over to the next period.
meanings.sent1: The noncumulative points in the game did not transfer to the next round.
meanings.sent2: Her noncumulative vacation days could not be used after the year ended.
meanings.sent3: The noncumulative leftovers had to be eaten before the new batch was made.
meanings.sent4: The noncumulative balance on the gift card could not be rolled over to the next month.
meanings.sent5: The noncumulative coupons had to be used before they expired.
